event: The mouse is clicking on the desktop.
description: The mouse click on the desktop triggers the appearance of a context menu.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Properties" option in the right-click context menu.
description: The user clicks on the "Properties" option in the right-click context menu. This opens the "Display Properties" window.
outcome: The Windows XP desktop now displays the "Display Properties" window with the "Themes" tab active. The "Display Properties" window contains "Active Window" dialog box, which displays the text "Window Text". The right-click context menu from the initial state is no longer visible.

event: The mouse pointer is hovering over the "Screen Saver" tab of the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "Screen Saver" tab in the "Display Properties" window. As a result, the window's content changes to display the "Screen Saver" settings.
outcome: The "Display Properties" window is now displaying the "Screen Saver" tab instead of the previously active "Themes" tab. The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu shows "Windows XP" is selected, and the "Wait" time is set to "10" minutes. The "Settings" button is now visible next to the "Screen Saver" dropdown. The "Save As..." and "Delete" buttons are not present in this view.

event: The mouse is clicking on the down arrow of the "Screen saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicked the down arrow of the "Screen Saver" dropdown menu in the "Display Properties" window to expand the list of available options.
outcome: The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu within the "Display Properties" window is expanded, and the "(None)" option is selected.

event: The mouse is clicking on the empty space of the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicked on the empty space within the "Display Properties" window.
outcome: A pop-up window titled "Keep your computer up to date" appeared in the bottom left corner, prompting the user to enable automatic updates.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Power..." button within the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "Power..." button in the "Monitor power" section of the "Display Properties" window.  As a result, the "Power Options Properties" window opens.
outcome: A new window titled "Power Options Properties" has appeared over the "Display Properties" window, becoming the active window.  The new window contains a "Power Schemes" tab with various power management settings including dropdown menus for "Turn off monitor", "Turn off hard disks", "System standby", and "System hibernates".

event: The mouse pointer is clicking on the down arrow of the "Power schemes" dropdown menu in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the down arrow of the "Power schemes" dropdown menu within the "Power Options Properties" window.
outcome: The "Power schemes" dropdown menu in the "Power Options Properties" window is expanded, revealing a list of available power schemes.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Presentation" item in the "Power schemes" dropdown menu of the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user selects the "Presentation" option from the "Power schemes" dropdown menu within the "Power Options Properties" window.
outcome: The "Power Options Properties" window reflects new power settings: the "Presentation" power scheme is selected. Additionally, a "Keep your computer up to date" notification bubble has appeared in the bottom right corner of the screen.

event: The mouse pointer is clicking the dropdown button of the "Turn off monitor" option in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the dropdown button next to the "Turn off monitor" option within the "Settings for Presentation power scheme" section. This reveals a dropdown menu with various time options for the monitor to turn off automatically.
outcome: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the drop-down menus for "Turn off monitor", "Turn off hard disks", "System standby", and "System hibernates" are expanded, displaying the available options. Additionally, a pop-up notification "Keep your computer up to date" is displayed in the bottom right corner, above the taskbar.

event: The mouse clicked the "Never" option in the "System hibernates" dropdown menu in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicked "Never" in the "System hibernates" dropdown menu under the "Settings for Presentation power scheme" section of the "Power Options Properties" window. This action closed the dropdown menu and set the system to never hibernate automatically.
outcome: The "System hibernates" dropdown menu within "Power Options Properties" is now closed. The mouse cursor moved to hover over the "OK" button. Additionally, a pop-up notification titled "Keep your computer up to date" appeared in the bottom left corner of the screen.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Apply" button in the "Power Options Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "Apply" button to save the changes made to the "Presentation" power scheme settings within the "Power Options Properties" window.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "Screen Saver" tab of the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks on the "Screen Saver" tab in the "Display Properties" window.  As a result, the window's content changes to display the "Screen Saver" settings.
outcome: The "Display Properties" window is now displaying the "Screen Saver" tab. The selected screensaver is "(None)", the wait time is set to "10", and the mouse cursor is hovering over the "OK" button.

event: The mouse is clicking on the "OK" button in the "Display Properties" window.
description: The user clicks the "OK" button in the "Display Properties" window. As a result, the "Display Properties" window is no longer visible.
